channel.title: Crypto on interesting things
channel.description: Recent content in Crypto on interesting things

item.title: Verified GitHub commits with Keybase
item.description: A while back, GitHub announced support for GPG signature verification. Now, git has supported signing commits and tags for a while, but it was a pain to manually verify signed commits, so I’m not sure the average developer even considered it. I saw the announcement, and messed around with it for a few minutes then forgot about it, because I don’t use GPG very often, and it hadn’t yet clicked that Keybase is really just a GPG management tool…

item.title: Getting YubiKey working with Docker Content Trust on OS X
item.description: Getting YubiKey working with Docker Content Trust on OS X This wasn’t as straightforward as I would’ve liked, so I’m documenting this here. First, some super-useful sources: Diogo MÃ³nica’s blog posting from DockerCon EU 2015 (DOCKER CONTENT TRUST GETS HARDWARE SIGNING) docker/notary#779 (Improve docs for typical CI usage with docker+notary) The YubiKey PIV CLI tool v1.4.3 zip docker/toolbox#461 (from here I gleaned that /usr/local/docker/lib is understood by notary) I only figured this out because the folks above did most of the work!
